intro: Scabiosa brachycarpa, commonly known as the dwarf scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, making it well-suited for rock gardens or borders. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Scabiosa brachycarpa is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun conditions.
